MIME element (text/plain)
Date: 01/19/2007 
 
  
 
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. 
 
1333 North Stemmons Freeway 
 
Suite 110 
 
Dallas, TX 75207 USA 
 
  
 
RE:  ORECK TRADEMARK INFRINGEMENT AND DILUTION 
 
  
 
IP Address: 74.52.216.42 
 
Web Addresses: www.vtvtfghs.org <http://www.vtvtfghs.org/> ,
www.xzahzssx.org <http://www.xzahzssx.org/> , www.kidmcynl.org
<http://www.kidmcynl.org/> , www.lydtajmu.org <http://www.lydtajmu.org/>
, www.adneaveg.org <http://www.adneaveg.org/> , www.acooptbk.org
<http://www.acooptbk.org/> , www.bojnrdhf.org <http://www.bojnrdhf.org/>
., www.yzjjyzjay.org <http://www.yzjjyzjay.org/> , and www.tpcudcix.org 
<http://www.tpcudcix.org/>    
 
Infringement First Noticed: 01/10/2007 
 
Evidence: include printed out hard copies of sites, as well as those
still residing at web addresses above (a sample attached). 
 
  
 
To Whom It May Concern: 
 
  
 
I am counsel to the Oreck Corporation and its subsidiaries, including
Oreck Holdings, LLC ("Oreck").  The above referenced websites have been
brought to my attention by my clients, who have advised that a person
utilizing your hosting services has improperly used the Oreck name,
which is a federally protected trademark.  According to the contact
information related to these websites, each is run by a Myricacymir
Mainonokys, at Boleronti St., 12-97 in Pekin, China 776543 (Tel: 
800735541087, Email darkover@ud-corp.com).  This person is not an
authorized dealer or service center for Oreck products and is not
authorized to use Oreck trademarks or otherwise hold out to the public
as being authorized by, endorsed, or affiliated with Oreck. 
Accordingly, these practices constitute trademark infringement in
violation of state and federal law.  This person has yet to respond to
Oreck's complaints, and so my client is hoping that ThePlantet.com
Internet Services, Inc. ("ThePlanet.com") will be responsive to
resolving this situation involving a party who, among other things, has
breached your Acceptable Usage Policy (dated January, 15, 2007). 
 
  
 
Oreck Holdings, LLC is the owner in the United States of trademark
registration no. 1,454,954 for the mark, "Oreck."  Oreck has protected
its rights in this mark by securing federal trademark registration. 
This registration, by law, places the public on notice of Oreck's sole
and exclusive ownership throughout the United States of its exclusive
rights in its mark, Oreck, in connection with vacuum cleaners and other
home care products. 
 
  
 
The above referenced websites run by Myricacymir Mainonokys, hosted by
ThePlanet.com, use the Oreck mark in a manner that may cause confusion
or mistakes in the minds of consumers, and thus violate Oreck's
federally protected rights to its name and marks.  Yet even if these
webpages did not cause actual confusion over Myricacymir Mainonokys' 
endorsement or affiliation with Oreck, this person's use of the mark
"Oreck" on the webpages in question allow this person to free-ride
Oreck's goodwill and draw unwitting consumers to these websites,
creating initial interest confusion, an actionable offense under the
federal Lanham Act.  Moreover, the content of these websites, which
includes links and ads for adult websites, serves to tarnish Oreck's
good name, and therefore dilutes its trademark under the federal Lanham
Act, an offense that requires neither that the infringer be a competitor
of Oreck, nor that one confuses unwitting consumers.  It is Oreck's
position that Myricacymir Mainonokys is liable for each of these
offenses.  While Oreck understands that ThePlanet.com likely did not
have knowledge of this infringement, it is the intention of this letter
to bring such infringement to your attention.  Such infringement is, in
fact, a violation of your Intellectual Property Infringement Policy,
which is a part of your larger Acceptable Usage Policy. 
 
  
 
Therefore, with the knowledge that Myricacymir Mainonokys is infringing
upon Oreck's federal trademark rights, Oreck requests that ThePlanet.com
disable access to, or remove the infringing content from your servers. 
Failure to do so will result in Oreck pursuing any and all remedies
afforded under state and federal law.  At the very least, this will
encompass injunctions against use of this mark against Myricacymir
Mainonokys as a direct infringer and ThePlanet.com as a contributory
infringer.  If I do not see the Oreck mark removed from the above sites
within one week, or by January 26, 2007, I will be forced to consider
filing a trademark infringement suit against both Myricacymir Mainonokys
and ThePlanet.com, in Louisiana federal court. 
 
  
 
It is my sincere hope, however, that this end can be avoided, and the
problem solved amicably.  I thank you in advance for ThePlanet.com's
assistance in this matter.  In the event that you should have any
questions, please contact me at your convenience. 
 
  
 
  
 
Respectfully, 
 
  
 
  
 
/MTW/ 
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
Michael T. Wawrzycki, Esq. 
 
Associate Counsel 
Oreck, Bradley, Crighton, Adams & Chase LLC
